com.observability.monitoring.daemon

Class DaemonManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • com.observability.monitoring.daemon.DaemonManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDaemonManagerServer, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class DaemonManager
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements IDaemonManagerServer
    DaemonManager is a manager process that has the following functionalities:
    1. Start/stop collectd process on Ubuntu
    2. Communicate with metric engine to get configuration parameters
    3. Save configuration parameters to collectd conf file

    This program needs to be started with sudo.

    Author:
    Ying (Joel) Gao

    History:
    1. Created May 29 2015
    2. Modified May 30 2015
    3. Modified May 31 2015
    4. Modified Jun 02 2015
    5. Modified Jun 07 2015
    6. Modified Jun 19 2015

    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • killProcess

        public static void killProcess(java.lang.String process)
        Kill process by the process name.
        This method runs the following commands as external process.
        pidof: get pid of collectd process;
        sudo kill: kill the process with sudo privilege;
        If there are multiple collectd processes, all of them will be killed.
        Parameters:
        process - name of the process

      • startProcess

        public static void startProcess(java.lang.String process)
        Start the process by name, this class file should be in the same folder as the target program.
        Parameters:
        process - name of the process

      • changeConfiguration

        public boolean changeConfiguration(java.lang.String oldconfig,
                          java.lang.String newconfig)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Change configuration of a section. There are two kinds of configurations:
        1. Single line that outside any sections;
        2. Sections (inside < and >);

        For example:

        <LoadPlugin perl>
        Interval 60
        </LoadPlugin>

        If the oldconfig is null, newconfig will be appended to the end of configuration file as a new section.

        This function can be called multiple times to change multiple sections.

        Specified by:
        changeConfiguration in interface IDaemonManagerServer
        Parameters:
        oldconfig - the old configuration value, for a section, it includes everything.
        newconfig - the new configuration value, for a section, it includes everything.
        Returns:
        true/false
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - connection error

      • replaceWholeConfiguration
